notes: Second generation on A2 platform. Multiple engine options from 1.6L to 1.8L gasoline, plus 1.6L turbo diesel. FWD only. Manual or automatic transmission. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

First generation Jetta on A1 platform. Sedan version of Golf/Rabbit. Multiple gasoline engines plus 1.6L turbo diesel. FWD only. Manual or automatic transmission. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation Golf on A2 platform. Multiple gasoline engines from 1.6L to 1.8L, plus 1.6L turbo diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

First generation Golf sold as Rabbit in North America (A1 platform). Multiple gasoline engines plus 1.6L diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

First generation GTI sold as Rabbit GTI in North America. 1.8L fuel-injected four-cylinder. FWD. Manual transmission only. 2-door hatchback. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation performance hatchback on A2 platform. 1.8L or 2.0L 16-valve four-cylinder. FWD. Manual transmission only. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation sport coupe on A2 platform. 1.7L or 1.8L four-cylinder. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. 3-door liftback coupe design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Scirocco article, January 2025 revision.

Convertible based on Golf Mk1 platform (A1), continued production into Mk2 era. 1.8L four-cylinder. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Soft-top convertible. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

North American name for Passat B2. Multiple engine options from 1.7L to 2.2L inline-five, plus 1.6L diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as sedan or wagon. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Type 2 T3 generation van. Air-cooled or water-cooled flat-four engines, plus diesel option. Rear-engine RWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available in passenger, cargo, and Westfalia camper configurations. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Type 2 article, January 2025 revision.

Final years of original Beetle in North America. 1.6L air-cooled flat-four. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Beetle article, January 2025 revision.
